summary: The "cultivation system" refers to the structured methodologies employed in the cultivation of agricultural land within the European Union. This concept encompasses various practices and regulatory frameworks aimed at optimizing agricultural productivity while ensuring compliance with EU environmental standards. The cultivation system is integral to the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP), which promotes sustainable farming practices and supports farmers in adapting to market demands. By establishing guidelines for crop rotation, soil management, and resource allocation, the cultivation system plays a crucial role in enhancing food security and fostering rural development across member states.
